content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table, with 5 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is "x," and the heading for row 2 is "f prime of x." The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is negative 1. f prime of x is 11. Column 2. x is 0. f prime of x is 9. Column 3. x is 2. f prime of x is 8. Column 4. x is 4. f prime of x is 5. Column 5. x is 5. f prime of x is 2." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mn>11</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>9</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>8</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a twice-differentiable function. Values of <math alttext="f prime" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, the derivative of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, at selected values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are given in the table above. Which of the following statements must be true?

choices.label: <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is increasing for <math alttext="negative 1 is less than or equal to x, which is less than or equal to 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is concave down for <math alttext="negative 1 is less than x, which is less than 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

There exists <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="negative 1 is less than c, which is less than 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>c</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, such that <math alttext="f prime of c, equals negative three halves" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

There exists <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="negative 1 is less than c, which is less than 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>c</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, such that <math alttext="f double prime of c, equals negative three halves" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: There exists <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="negative 1 is less than c, which is less than 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>c</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, such that <math alttext="f double prime of c, equals negative three halves" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
